programme.title: Dealin' With Idiots
programme.desc: A comic looks for inspiration for his next movie among the absurdly competitive parents and coaches involved with his son's youth-baseball league.

programme.title: Brockmire
programme.desc: In the year 2030, the world is in chaos but at least Jim broadcasts his favorite sport and has the love of his daughter; Jim then learns baseball is worse off than he thinks and his daughter is moving to New York for college.

programme.title: Brockmire
programme.desc: Jim is trying hard to enact change in the league but the owners don't seem to care or want it; at the same time, Jim's relationship with his daughter is becoming worse, with visits becoming less frequent as she pulls away and becomes an adult.

programme.title: Brockmire
programme.desc: Baseball is barely holding on so Jim turns to the one person he knows can turn it around, Jules James; however, it's going to take a lot of convincing to get her to leave Morristown to help a sport and man who both turned their backs on her.

programme.title: Brockmire
programme.desc: Jim and Jules agree to keep their relationship professional, but when they team up to trick the owners into selling the teams to new owners who will let them make the changes they want, their antics remind them of the relationship they used to have.

programme.title: Brockmire
programme.desc: Jules tries to win Beth's approval of the relationship she and Brockmire are trying to rekindle, but they don't get along until Jules takes Beth under her wing as a drinking buddy; Jim is irate that Jules was a bad influence on his daughter.

programme.title: Brockmire
programme.desc: As Beth was growing up, Jim told her everything he knew about her deceased birth mother, but she finds out that he lied to her; on the biggest day of Jim's life, Beth is supposed to give a speech to memorialize him.

programme.title: Brockmire
programme.desc: Baseball players' union contracts are up for re-negotiation and a potential strike threatens the future of baseball altogether; Jim and Jules give it one last go and try to negotiate the terms of their potential relationship.

programme.title: Brockmire
programme.desc: Artificial intelligence threatens to take steps in its pursuit to rule the world and attempts to take over baseball. Jim and Jules must decide if they want to embolden this emerging society ruled by machines or stay with the failing status quo.

programme.title: Portlandia
programme.desc: Peter and Nance go to great lengths to make sure that their restaurant order is ethical and humane; restroom policy.

programme.title: Portlandia
programme.desc: Fred and Carrie meet the Mayor of Portland; Toni and Candace help a student at the Feminist Bookstore.

programme.title: Portlandia
programme.desc: Fred and Carrie discover that their maid is is their favorite singer-songwriter Aimee Mann; Spike decides it's over; Coffee Land.

programme.title: Portlandia
programme.desc: Much to their dismany, Fred and Carrie learn the Mayor has gone missing so they begin a frantic search for him.

programme.title: Portlandia
programme.desc: A new music and film festival takes over Portland and Fred, Carrie and all of Portland gets swept up in the excitement.

programme.title: Portlandia
programme.desc: The Mayor turns to Fred and Carrie to help him put together a big league baseball team; an artisinal light bulb maker.

programme.title: Portlandia
programme.desc: Fred and Carrie decide to venture outside of Portland and along the way they learn about the special art of love.

programme.title: Portlandia
programme.desc: Fred and Carrie become obsessed with "Battlestar Galactica" and try to get the cast to make a new episode; Allergy Pride Parade; Artisan Knot Shop.

programme.title: Portlandia
programme.desc: Spyke and Irys want an unconventional wedding; Toni and Candace have a book signing; dropped iPhone; no bag at the supermarket.

programme.title: Portlandia
programme.desc: Brendan and Michelle try to get their son into a prestigious preschool; Keith and Dave take their rescued dog to a dog park.

programme.title: Portlandia
programme.desc: The mayor of Portland asks Fred and Carrie for their help to give the police force a much-needed makeover.

programme.title: Portlandia
programme.desc: After achieving success by including their cat in their band, "Cat Nap" is kidnapped by an obsessed fan.

programme.title: Portlandia
programme.desc: Peter and Nance try to spice things up in their love life after someone calls Peter an old man; moving a harp.

programme.title: Portlandia
programme.desc: A 10th anniversary party is thrown for Toni and Candace at the Feminist Bookstore but a surprise guest shows up with her boyfriend.

programme.title: Portlandia
programme.desc: Fred and Carrie convince the Mayor that the Olympics should be barred from Portland but quickly change their minds once they meet Olympian Greg Louganis.

programme.title: Portlandia
programme.desc: Peter, Nance, Fred, Carrie, the Mayor and most of the city of Portland find a new brunch spot which annoys Toni and Candace.

programme.title: Portlandia
programme.desc: It's wintertime in Portlandia and Peter and Nance struggle to keep off winter weight by cutting pasta from their diets; Candace's son visits Women and Women First bookstore for the holidays; a couple tries to keep their food cart in business.

programme.title: Portlandia
programme.desc: Spyke and Iris join forces with a gang of former MTV stars to take back MTV from the Tweens; a group of frustrated college grads stage a protest on the dance floor; Sandra has a crush on a mysterious man in her meditation class.

programme.title: Portlandia
programme.desc: The Mayor sends Fred and Carrie on a door-to-door mission to Seattle to recruit new citizens for Portland; pedicab driver hustles for clients; Peter and Nance prepare for the opening of their Bed and Breakfast with a visit to The Doily Shoppe.

programme.title: Portlandia
programme.desc: Nina goes to great lengths to throw an extravagant 32nd birthday party for herself. The day-long event is set to include activities ranging from horseback rides to sunrise yoga that will last well into the night. The party turns into a Tapas Dinner.

programme.title: Portlandia
programme.desc: Concerned parents Brendan and Michelle start a band that makes kids music; The Portland Nerd Council issues a Public Service Announcement; Malcom and Kris have an uncomfortable lunch at a vegan restaurant. The Feminist Bookstore hosts a comedy night.

programme.title: Portlandia
programme.desc: Following an environmental scandal, The Mayor steps down from office and moves off the grid; a dolphin discovers that plastic bags have been banned in Portland; musicians compete in a Battle of the Gentle Bands.

programme.title: Portlandia
programme.desc: A temp worker hopes to turn her stint as Interim Mayor of Portland into a full-time job with Fred and Carrie's help; a wedding is interrupted; local baristas draft a coffee shop manifesto; Kath and Dave struggle to find a table at a restaurant.

programme.title: Portlandia
programme.desc: Peter and Nance practice hosting friends at the soft opening of their bed and breakfast; a magazine features a local furniture maker in their Man Issue; steampunks attend a convention; Fred takes a love interest on a bold third date.

programme.title: Portlandia
programme.desc: The City of Portland is overrun with art projects; Fred and Carrie's relationship is complicated by their roommate Alexandra; a movie theater sells artisanal concessions. Kath and Dave are concerned about the coyotes in their neighborhood.

programme.title: Portlandia
programme.desc: The Rats decide to move out of their newly-gentrified neighborhood; first-time parents read various child-rearing books; Gahvin and his girlfriend go to the movies; Carrie and Alexandra have dinner at a communal table.

programme.title: Portlandia
programme.desc: Electricity is shut off for the entire city as a result of unpaid bills at the Mayor's office; Peter and Nance have a mysterious guest at their bed and breakfast.

programme.title: Portlandia
programme.desc: A young woman is haunted by very smart ghosts; Doug and Claire make a big commitment to one another; Kath and Dave make the most of fifteen minutes; Sandra finally finds a soul mate; Fred is visited by a Date Fact Checker.

programme.title: Portlandia
programme.desc: Ecoterrorists protest animal testing at a makeup company; Bryce and Lisa Rent it Out!; Toni and Candace have a car wash; Fred misses hip hop; Dave helps Kath get a good night's sleep.

programme.title: Portlandia
programme.desc: A celery salesman goes to great lengths to have celery become more popular; 911 dispatchers assure callers that it's beets; The Order Grill is open for lunch; Carrie declares social bankruptcy; a fed up office worker wants to become a gutter punk.

programme.title: Portlandia
programme.desc: A punk from the 1980s wakes up from a coma; an e-mail goes neglected; Nina has surprising news for Lance; Malcolm and Kris tailgate a "Prairie Home Companion" live show; Carrie dates a tax lawyer.

programme.title: Portlandia
programme.desc: Nance is driven to the emergency room; Ghavin questions a singer; Fred and Carrie have a garage sale; dinner guests are held hostage.

programme.title: Portlandia
programme.desc: Carrie and Fred go home after a concert; Fred has an idea for a music documentary; Peter is reunited with his old band, The Bahama Knights and his ex-wife who is the lead singer.

programme.title: Portlandia
programme.desc: Toni and Candace coach a dance team; Kickstarter videos compete at a Film Festival; Toni and Candace coach the Portland Trail Blazers' dance team.

programme.title: Portlandia
programme.desc: Mr. Mayor plans a parade; Brendan decides to try drugs; Carrie's brother visits with his new boyfriend.

programme.title: Portlandia
programme.desc: Mr. Mayor uncovers Portland's official 3D printer; Lance and Nina's lizard dies; Santa worries about the future of Christmas.

programme.title: Portlandia
programme.desc: Toni and Candace lead a feminist retreat for women in New Beaverton, Ohio; Peter and Nance go on a walking tour.

programme.title: Portlandia
programme.sub-title: The Story of Toni and Candace
programme.desc: The origin of the feminist bookstore; a merger between two corporate book retailers pits Toni and Candace against one another in fierce competition to be head of the Chick Lit Department.
